rules: Rule1: If event1 is prohibited, then event1 is approved.
Rule2: In the event that event1 is prohibited, it is not the case that wine1 has high alcohol content.
Rule3: Either the label of wine1 is approved or, if wine1 is filtered properly, then fermentation of wine1 being complete implies wine1 is ready for sale.
Rule4: Either the alcohol content of wine1 is verified or the label of wine1 is not approved.
Rule5: Either the origin of region1 is certified or the alcohol content of wine1 is not verified.
Rule6: If wine1 has undergone chemical treatment, then wine1 is not contaminated.
Rule7: If wine1 has undergone natural clarification, then wine1 is not contaminated.
Rule8: If sale of wine1 is authorized, then either wine1 has undergone chemical treatment or wine1 has undergone natural clarification.
Rule9: Should wine1 be sold domestically, then sale of wine1 is authorized.
Rule10: Either wine1 is sold domestically or wine1 is sold regionally.
Rule11: When wine1 is sold regionally, then wine1 is sold nationally.
Rule12: If wine1 is sold nationally, then wine1 is sold internationally.
Rule13: If wine1 is sold internationally, then wine1 is sold as a specialty item.
Rule14: Provided wine1 is sold as a specialty item, sale of wine1 is authorized.
Rule15: Either region1 is a banned region or period1 is not a vintage year.
Rule16: If region1 is under political sanctions, then region1 is not a banned region.
Rule17: Either region1 is under political sanctions or region1 has quality violations.
Rule18: On condition that region1 has quality violations, import to region1 is restricted.
Rule19: Provided a trade embargo applies to region1, region1 has environmental violations.
Rule20: Either a trade embargo applies to region1 or health concerns exist for region1.
Rule21: If health concerns exist for region1, then import to region1 being restricted implies region1 is not a banned region.
Rule22: When wine1 is a fortified wine, then wine1 has high alcohol content.
Rule23: Either region1 uses traditional methods or, if event1 is prohibited, then wine1 is a fortified wine.
Rule24: Should region1 use modern equipment, then region1 does not use traditional methods.
Rule25: Either region1 uses modern equipment or region1 uses a hybrid approach.
Rule26: Either region1 uses an experimental process or, if region1 uses a hybrid approach, then region1 does not use traditional methods.
Rule27: Provided region1 is organically certified, region1 is sustainably certified.
Rule28: Either region1 is organically certified or region1 is biodynamically certified.
Rule29: If region1 is biodynamically certified, then period1 being a harvest season implies event1 is not approved.
Rule30: Provided region1 is eco-friendly certified, period1 being a harvest season implies event1 is not approved.

Rule31: Either wine1 is counterfeit or, if it is not the case that wine1 being premium quality implies region1 being sustainably certified implies region1 is eco-friendly certified, then wine1 is of standard quality.
Rule32: Should wine1 have been laboratory tested, then wine1 is not counterfeit.
Rule33: Either wine1 has been laboratory tested or wine1 has been verified by an expert.
Rule34: If wine1 has been verified by an expert, then wine1 is not counterfeit.
Rule35: In the case that wine1 is authentic, then region1 is not a banned region.
Rule36: Either wine1 is mislabeled or wine1 is authentic.
Rule37: When wine1 has proper documentation, then wine1 is not mislabeled.
Rule38: Provided the origin of wine1 is verified, then wine1 is not mislabeled.
Rule39: Should region1 have been granted certification, then export of wine1 is allowed.
Rule40: If import of wine1 is approved, then either wine1 has proper documentation or the origin of wine1 is verified.
Rule41: Either import of wine1 is approved or export of wine1 is approved.
Rule42: If a trade agreement exists for region1, then export of wine1 being approved implies either wine1 has proper documentation or the origin of wine1 is verified.
Rule43: Either a trade agreement exists for region1 or a bilateral treaty exists for region1.
Rule44: In the event there is market demand for wine1, then a trade dispute does not exist for region1.
Rule45: Either there is market demand for wine1 or wine1 is a limited edition.
Rule46: If wine1 is a limited edition, then a trade dispute does not exist for region1.
Rule47: Should wine1 be a collector's item, then either wine1 is a rare vintage or period1 is not a vintage year.
Rule48: Provided wine1 is investment grade, then either wine1 is a rare vintage or period1 is not a vintage year.
Rule49: If export of wine1 is allowed, then either wine1 has passed quality testing or, if period1 is a harvest season, then event1 is not approved.
Rule50: When wine1 is available on the market, then either wine1 is a collector's item or wine1 is investment grade.
Rule51: Provided wine1 has been aged properly, then fermentation of wine1 being complete implies wine1 is ready for sale.
Rule52: Either wine1 has been aged properly or wine1 has been filtered properly.
Rule53: If it is not the case that region1 having environmental violations implies import to region1 being restricted implies region1 is not a banned region, then a temporary ban applies to region1.

Rule54: If it is not the case that region1 having environmental violations implies import to region1 being restricted implies region1 is not a banned region, then a temporary ban does not apply to region1.
Rule55: If it is not the case that wine1 being premium quality implies region1 being sustainably certified implies region1 is eco-friendly certified, then wine1 is not of standard quality.

Rule56: Should it not be the case that a bilateral treaty existing for region1 implies export of wine1 being approved implies either wine1 has proper documentation or the origin of wine1 is verified, then a trade dispute exists for region1.
Rule57: In the event wine1 is not available on the market, then wine1 is in reserved stock.
Rule58: If wine1 is not available on the market, then wine1 is not in reserved stock.
Rule59: Provided wine1 is not ready for sale, then event1 is prohibited.
Rule60: If wine1 is not ready for sale, then wine1 is contaminated.
Rule61: When wine1 is not ready for sale, then period1 is a vintage year.
facts: Fact1: Period1 is a harvest season.
Fact2: Wine1 is of premium quality.
Fact3: Region1 has been granted certification.
Fact4: Fermentation of wine1 is complete.
Fact5: The origin of region1 is not certified.
Fact6: Region1 does not use an experimental process.
Fact7: Wine1 has not passed quality testing.
Fact8: Wine1 is not a rare vintage.
